N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 343.6 - Application process

State Regulations
(a) Forms. Application for approval as a certified provider of an alcohol awareness
program for youth shall be on forms provided by the division. (b) Notice of requirements. Applications must
conform to the procedure and specifications set forth in the notice of
requirements provided by the Division. (c) Signed by applicant. Each application
form shall be signed by the applicant. (d) Requisite information. Applications shall
include, but shall not be limited to, the following: (1)
background of the applicant, including a
brief description of the applicant itself and its experience in providing
alcohol-related prevention education for youth services; (2)
description of the target population and
geographical area to be served; (3)
a letter of endorsement of both the program and the program provider from the
local community services board; (4)
proof and descriptions of arrangements with local magistrates and/or
judges; (5)
a statement specifying
the age group to be served by theapplicant in accordance with section
343.5
of this Part; (6)
a statement outlining the qualifications
of each program instructor; (7)
a
description of the physical facilities where the program will be
offered; (8)
a schedule of the days
and hours of proposed program offerings; (9)
a description of the proposed program
which indicates how it addresses requisite learning objectives as determined by
the director in each of the following categories: (i) laws and the criminal justice
system; (ii)
characteristics of
alcohol; (iii)
understanding
alcoholism/addiction; (iv)
family
dynamics and issues regarding children of alcoholics; (v) societal issues; (vi)
youth issues; (vii)
choices and alternatives; (viii)
self assessment; and
(ix)
community resources; (10)
a budget statement which
describes costs and revenues for an eight week program, including proposed fees
and a provision for fee reductions that may be mandated by the courts; and
(11)
such other information as
the division designates. Notes
